style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s62666D120F685E67A8C71BFDD8F55B9B"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">STATEMENT ON FORWARD-LOOKING INFORMATION</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Certain information included in this report or in other materials we have filed or will file with the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) (as well as information included in oral statements or other written statements made or to be made by us) contains or may contain forward-looking statements within the meaning of Section&#160;27A of the Securities Act of 1933, as amended, and Section&#160;21E of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended. One can identify these statements by the fact that they do not relate to matters of a strictly historical or factual nature and generally discuss or relate to future events. These statements contain words such as &#8220;anticipate,&#8221; &#8220;estimate,&#8221; &#8220;expect,&#8221; &#8220;project,&#8221; &#8220;intend,&#8221; &#8220;plan,&#8221; &#8220;believe,&#8221; &#8220;may,&#8221; &#8220;can,&#8221; &#8220;could,&#8221; &#8220;might,&#8221; &#8220;should,&#8221; and other words or phrases of similar meaning. Such statements may include, but are not limited to, information related to: market conditions; demand for our homes; anticipated operating results; home deliveries; financial resources and condition; changes in revenues; changes in profitability; changes in margins; changes in accounting treatment; cost of revenues; selling, general, and administrative expenses; interest expense; inventory write-downs; home warranty and construction defect claims; unrecognized tax benefits; anticipated tax refunds; sales paces and prices; effects of home buyer cancellations; growth and expansion; joint ventures in which we are involved; anticipated results from our investments in unconsolidated entities; the ability to acquire land and pursue real estate opportunities; the ability to gain approvals and open new communities; the ability to sell homes and properties; the ability to deliver homes from backlog; the ability to secure materials and subcontractors; the ability to produce the liquidity and capital necessary to expand and take advantage of opportunities; and legal proceedings, investigations, and claims. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">From time to time, forward-looking statements also are included in other reports on Forms 10-K, 10-Q, and 8-K; in press releases; in presentations; on our website; and in other materials released to the public. Any or all of the forward-looking statements included in this report and in any other reports or public statements made by us are not guarantees of future performance and may turn out to be inaccurate. This can occur as a result of incorrect assumptions or as a consequence of known or unknown risks and uncertainties. Many factors mentioned in this report or in other reports or public statements made by us, including macroeconomic factors such as employment levels, interest rates, consumer confidence and spending, housing demand, availability of financing for home buyers, availability and prices of new homes compared to existing inventory, demographic trends, government regulation, and the competitive environment, will be important in determining our future performance. Consequently, actual results may differ materially from those that might be anticipated from our forward-looking statements.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Forward-looking statements speak only as of the date they are made. We undertake no obligation to publicly update any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events, or otherwise.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">For a more detailed discussion of these factors, see the information under the captions &#8220;Risk Factors&#8221; and &#8220;Management&#8217;s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations&#8221; in our most recent Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC and in this report.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">When this report uses the words &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; &#8220;our,&#8221; and the &#8220;Company,&#8221; they refer to Toll Brothers, Inc. and its subsidiaries, unless the context otherwise requires. References herein to fiscal year refer to our fiscal years ended or ending October 31.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><a id="s818867F8EC8A5DC4B805922431C0D875"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:13px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">PART I.  FINANCIAL INFORMATION</span></div><div><a id="s7ADE303FC19F5C5A99E2591329D2066D"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">ITEM 1.  FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</span></div><div><a id="sAA70069B21595B00B243B0C0BDB5067F"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED BALANCE SHEETS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(Amounts in thousands)</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><div style="padding-left:0px;text-indent:0px;line-height:normal;padding-top:10px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="font-family:Times New style="line-height:120%;padding-top:13px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">TOLL BROTHERS, INC.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">NOTES TO CONDENSED CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">(Unaudited)</span></div><div><a id="s6DCCD51069C85321AAE16537FC8CD8BE"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">1. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock" id="TextSelection-8EC23C4331465251B0291FF153CE5F05-0-wk-Fact-001496C710B75604BD72A1455BA82B5B" continuedAt="TextSelection-8EC23C4331465251B0291FF153CE5F05-1" escape="true">Significant Accounting Policies</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8EC23C4331465251B0291FF153CE5F05-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-8EC23C4331465251B0291FF153CE5F05-2"><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-ED63B768EE595D46B55F9C46A6B9DC3B-0-wk-Fact-7FE1EDC8155F5BD6820E28C7D037E210" continuedAt="TextSelection-ED63B768EE595D46B55F9C46A6B9DC3B-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Basis of Presentation</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements include the accounts of Toll Brothers, Inc. (the &#8220;Company,&#8221; &#8220;we,&#8221; &#8220;us,&#8221; or &#8220;our&#8221;), a Delaware corporation, and its majority owned subsidiaries. All significant intercompany accounts and transactions have been eliminated. Investments in 50% or less owned partnerships and affiliates are accounted for using the equity method unless it is determined that we have effective control of the entity, in which case we would consolidate the entity. </span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-ED63B768EE595D46B55F9C46A6B9DC3B-1" continuedAt="TextSelection-ED63B768EE595D46B55F9C46A6B9DC3B-2"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (&#8220;SEC&#8221;) for interim financial information. The </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> balance sheet amounts and disclosures included herein have been derived from our </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> audited financial statements. Since the accompanying condensed consolidated financial statements do not include all the information and footnotes required by U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) for complete financial statements, they should be read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements and notes thereto included in our Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> (&#8220;</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Form 10-K&#8221;). In the opinion of management, the accompanying unaudited condensed consolidated financial statements include all adjustments, which are of a normal recurring nature, necessary to present fairly our financial position as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">; the results of our operations and changes in equity for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">-month periods ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">; and our cash flows for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">-month periods ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span></ix:continuation><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-ED63B768EE595D46B55F9C46A6B9DC3B-2">. The results of operations for such interim periods are not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for the full year.</ix:continuation> </span></div><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:RevenueRecognitionPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-FFAD902999235B7D827FDB4CD028CE7E-0-wk-Fact-5D146C58235B577183BC229F86D765D5" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revenue Recognition</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Home sales revenues:</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Revenues and cost of revenues from home sales are recognized at the time each home is delivered and title and possession are transferred to the buyer. For the majority of our home closings, our performance obligation to deliver a home is satisfied in less than one year from the date a binding sale agreement is signed. In certain states where we build, we are not able to complete certain outdoor features prior to the closing of the home. To the extent these separate performance obligations are not complete upon the home closing, we defer a portion of the home sales revenues related to these obligations and subsequently recognize the revenue upon completion of such obligations. As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the home sales revenues and related costs we deferred related to these obligations were immaterial. Our contract liabilities, consisting of deposits received from customers for sold but undelivered homes, totaled </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581379e499-wk-Fact-30351142C6205F5592110AA0D9E0C692" name="us-gaap:CustomerAdvancesAndDeposits" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">417.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581379e503-wk-Fact-BB8FD5608CAC57F9A4715B08B3AA9D41" name="us-gaap:CustomerAdvancesAndDeposits" contextRef="FI2019Q1" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">385.6</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively. Of the outstanding customer deposits held as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we recognized </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581379e520-wk-Fact-D501B9432DFE5CC98978EC9B7C6F7F51" name="us-gaap:ContractWithCustomerLiabilityRevenueRecognized" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_ProductOrServiceAxis_us-gaap_HomeBuildingMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">85.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in home sales revenues during the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">three</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> months ended </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Land sales revenues:</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Our revenues from land sales generally consist of: (1) lot sales to third-party builders within our master planned communities; (2) land sales to joint ventures in which we retain an interest; and (3) bulk sales to third parties of land we have decided no longer meets our development criteria. In general, our performance obligation for each of these land sales is fulfilled upon the delivery of the land, which generally coincides with the receipt of cash consideration from the counterparty. For land sale transactions that contain repurchase options, revenues and related costs are not recognized until the repurchase option expires. In addition, when we sell land to a joint venture in which we retain an interest, we do not recognize revenue or gains on the sale to the extent of our retained interest in such joint venture. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Forfeited Customer Deposits: </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Forfeited customer deposits are recognized in &#8220;Home sales revenues&#8221; in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and Comprehensive Income in the period in which we determine that the customer will not complete the purchase of the home and we have the right to retain the deposit.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Sales Incentives:</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> In order to promote sales of our homes, we may offer our home buyers sales incentives. These incentives vary by type and amount on a community-by-community and home-by-home basis. Incentives are reflected as a reduction in home sales revenues. Incentives are recognized at the time the home is delivered to the home buyer and we receive the sales proceeds.</span></div></ix:nonNumeric><ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock" id="TextSelection-7111F711E9665A88BF22EAE5A9FED574-0-wk-Fact-FC2CFD40D6545A06922401AA132C52A4" continuedAt="TextSelection-7111F711E9665A88BF22EAE5A9FED574-1" escape="true"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:10px;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Recent Accounting Pronouncements</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In February 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-02, &#8220;Leases&#8221; (&#8220;ASU 2016-02&#8221;), which requires an entity to recognize assets and liabilities on the balance sheet for the rights and obligations created by leased assets and provide additional disclosures. In July 2018, the FASB issued ASU No. 2018-11, &#8220;Leases: Targeted Improvements&#8221; (&#8220;ASU 2018-11&#8221;), which provides an entity with the option to apply the transition provisions of the new standard at its adoption date instead of at its earliest comparative </span></div></ix:nonNumeric></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">6</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-7111F711E9665A88BF22EAE5A9FED574-1"><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-8EC23C4331465251B0291FF153CE5F05-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">period presented. ASU 2018-11 also provides an entity with a practical expedient that permits lessors to not separate nonlease components from the associated lease component if certain conditions are met. ASU 2016-02, as amended by ASU 2018-11, became effective for our fiscal year beginning November 1, 2019, and we adopted the new standard using a modified retrospective approach. The prior year period was not recast and our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet as of October 31, 2019 does not reflect any changes resulting from the adoption of the new standard. We elected to apply the transition provisions that allow us to carry forward our historical assessment of (1) whether contracts are or contain leases, (2) lease classification, and (3) initial direct costs. In addition, we elected the practical expedient that allows lessees the option to account for lease and non-lease components together as a single component for all classes of underlying assets. As a result of the adoption, we recorded a right-of-use (&#8220;ROU&#8221;) asset and lease liability of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581379e567-wk-Fact-9AFE83AA842B8FAC2C67A16D77B6DD16" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseRightOfUseAsset" contextRef="I2020Q1ASC842Impact_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">114.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581379e571-wk-Fact-BB51BFDFD300CDCC60DEA16F3DCCEE3A" name="us-gaap:OperatingLeaseLiability" contextRef="I2020Q1ASC842Impact_us-gaap_AdjustmentsForNewAccountingPronouncementsAxis_us-gaap_AccountingStandardsUpdate201602Member" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">118.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, as of November 1, 2019. The ROU asset is included in &#8220;Receivables, prepaid expenses, and other assets&#8221; and the corresponding lease liability is included in &#8220;Accrued expenses&#8221; in our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet. The adoption of ASU 2016-02 had no impact on retained earnings and did not materially impact our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and Comprehensive Income or Condensed Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In June 2016, the FASB issued ASU No. 2016-13, &#8220;Financial Instruments - Credit Losses (Topic 326): Measurement of Credit Losses on Financial Instruments&#8221; (&#8220;ASU 2016-13&#8221;). ASU 2016-13 replaces the current incurred loss impairment methodology with a methodology that reflects expected credit losses and requires consideration of a broader range of reasonable and supportable information to estimate credit losses. ASU 2016-13 will be effective for our fiscal year beginning November 1, 2020, with early adoption permitted as of November 1, 2019. We are currently evaluating the impact that the adoption of ASU 2016-13 may have on our consolidated financial statements and disclosures.</span></div></ix:continuation></ix:continuation><div><a id="sA51B66FE30F956489E3E440E325DD710"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">2. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:BusinessCombinationDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-7E92DD41B8FA53008D81A51F0D42D7FA-0-wk-Fact-D11906005503581197D97B5C914E4C24" continuedAt="TextSelection-7E92DD41B8FA53008D81A51F0D42D7FA-1" escape="true">Acquisitions </ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-7E92DD41B8FA53008D81A51F0D42D7FA-1"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">During fiscal 2019, we acquired substantially all of the assets and operations of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d10581242e378-wk-Fact-E02FF6C30F9B2BD89D6089C75CE2265D" name="us-gaap:BusinessAcquisitionNameOfAcquiredEntity" (&#8220;Sharp&#8221;) and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d10581242e382-wk-Fact-9713E02AFBECD995315089CE9514A79E" name="us-gaap:BusinessAcquisitionNameOfAcquiredEntity" contextRef="FD2019Q4YTD_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SabalHomesMember">Sabal Homes LLC</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span id="d10581242e386-wk-Fact-B4E69AD159DE5D1093A7E8563658947B" name="us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireBusinessesNetOfCashAcquired" contextRef="FD2019Q4YTD_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">162.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in cash. Sharp operates in metropolitan Atlanta, Georgia; Sabal operates in the Charleston, Greenville, and Myrtle Beach, South Carolina markets. The assets acquired, based on our preliminary purchase price allocations, were primarily inventory, including approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e390-wk-Fact-8283BC8958925558846691C54DA7E2B7" name="tol:Numberofhomesitesincludedinacquisition" contextRef="FD2019Q4YTD_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="home_sites" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2,550</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> home sites owned or controlled through land purchase agreements. In connection with these acquisitions, we assumed contracts to deliver </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e394-wk-Fact-90DC5F9A462850BBB82A35D37CB9247D" name="tol:NumberOfHomesToBeDelivered" contextRef="I2019Q2Sharpacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="home_sites" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">204</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> homes with an aggregate value of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e399-wk-Fact-9824B313435950EDA549A9D25C710F5E" name="tol:SalesValueOfOutstandingDeliverHomes" contextRef="I2019Q2Sharpacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">96.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. The average price of undelivered homes at the dates of acquisitions was approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e403-wk-Fact-449DAED1666F5446BE1E7CEC8C102239" name="tol:AverageSalesPriceofBacklog" contextRef="I2019Q2Sharpacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">471,100</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. As a result of these acquisitions, our selling community count increased by </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e407-wk-Fact-2E6AAE7915D0554AAC225D35A9645F10" name="tol:Businessacquisitionnumberofsellingcommunities" contextRef="FD2019Q4YTD_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_SharpResidentialandSabalHomesMember" unitRef="communities" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">22</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> communities.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;">Subsequent event</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In February 2020, we acquired substantially all of the assets and operations of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d10581242e417-wk-Fact-0C0779321C776806F24FC0CEC0F5F274" name="us-gaap:BusinessAcquisitionNameOfAcquiredEntity" contextRef="D2020Q2thriveacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_ThriveResidentialMember">Thrive Residential</ix:nonNumeric></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> (&#8220;Thrive&#8221;), an urban in-fill builder with operations in Atlanta, Georgia and Nashville, Tennessee, for approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e421-wk-Fact-B1923552F11E34B31AA189A3305862DB" name="us-gaap:PaymentsToAcquireBusinessesNetOfCashAcquired" contextRef="D2020Q2thriveacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_ThriveResidentialMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">53.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in cash. The assets acquired were primarily inventory for future communities, including approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e425-wk-Fact-13E686E3809E9FAFBFC8994B11AE9E39" name="tol:Numberofhomesitesincludedinacquisition" contextRef="D2020Q2thriveacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_ThriveResidentialMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="home_sites" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">680</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> home sites owned or controlled through land purchase agreements. The acquisition is expected to add </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10581242e429-wk-Fact-61F19219A81A7F5B4C96994DAF89CCE7" name="tol:Businessacquisitionnumberofsellingcommunities" contextRef="D2020Q2thriveacq_us-gaap_BusinessAcquisitionAxis_tol_ThriveResidentialMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="communities" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">10</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> communities by the end of fiscal 2020.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The acquisitions discussed above were accounted for as a business combination and were not material to our results of operations or financial condition.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><a id="s6929E61537975E2AB8CE4DAEE5E86B72"></a></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-weight:bold;">3. <ix:nonNumeric contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD" name="us-gaap:InventoryDisclosureTextBlock" id="TextSelection-443FFDC9C6D2550182BD8661E60858E9-0-wk-Fact-1544F20937DD511C8F0C1CF65C286DF7" continuedAt="TextSelection-443FFDC9C6D2550182BD8661E60858E9-1" escape="true">Inventory</ix:nonNumeric></span></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-443FFDC9C6D2550182BD8661E60858E9-1" style="text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></td></tr></table></div><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></ix:nonNumeric><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Operating communities include communities offering homes for sale; communities that have sold all available home sites but have not completed delivery of the homes; communities that were previously offering homes for sale but are temporarily closed due to business conditions or non-availability of improved home sites and that are expected to reopen within 12 months of the end of the fiscal period being reported on; and communities preparing to open for sale. The carrying value attributable to operating communities includes the cost of homes under construction, land and land development costs, the carrying cost of home sites in current and future phases of these communities, and the carrying cost of model homes.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Communities that were previously offering homes for sale but are temporarily closed due to business conditions, do not have any remaining backlog, and are not expected to reopen within 12 months of the end of the fiscal period being reported on have been classified as land owned for future communities.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div In addition, we either own, have under contract, or under a letter of intent approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1430-wk-Fact-F4DFD53F1A355C08970DC0A407AEBCF5" name="us-gaap:NumberOfUnitsInRealEstateProperty" contextRef="FI2020Q1_tol_PropertyPhaseAxis_tol_InPlanningPhaseMember" unitRef="rental_units" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">13,400</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> units, including </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1434-wk-Fact-9777221D196457BAB3B4D0AA9D64BCB2" name="us-gaap:NumberOfUnitsInRealEstateProperty" contextRef="FI2020Q1_tol_PropertyPhaseAxis_us-gaap_AssetUnderConstructionMember" unitRef="rental_units" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">200</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> units under active development; we intend to develop these units in joint ventures with unrelated parties in the future.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the first quarter of fiscal 2020, we sold all of our ownership interest in one of our Rental Property Joint Ventures to our partner for cash of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1441-wk-Fact-943B3E4BB8475DCE86D38D9B88FCC039" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromSaleOfEquityMethodInvestments" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_RentalPropertyJointVenturesNorthernNewJerseyMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">16.8</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, net of closing costs. The joint venture had owned, developed, and operated multifamily residential apartments in northern New Jersey. In connection with the sale, the joint venture&#8217;s existing </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1445-wk-Fact-EEAEF594BC1958DA89A7D7A844F7CCBA" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2019Q4_tol_AffiliatedEntityAxis_tol_RentalPropertyJointVenturesNorthernNewJerseyMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">76.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> loan was assumed by our partner. in our Condensed Consolidated Statements of Operations and Comprehensive Income.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">9</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-D779C4A45EE95DC7A26902E65B80039B-3" continuedAt="TextSelection-D779C4A45EE95DC7A26902E65B80039B-4"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In the first quarter of fiscal 2020, we entered into </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1456-wk-Fact-62E0042C41ADA2001254A10EA88BD6DD" name="us-gaap:NumberOfRealEstateProperties" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_RentalPropertyJointVenturesnewfiscal2020Member" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">two</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> separate joint ventures with unrelated parties to develop (i) a luxury for-rent residential apartment project located in Dallas, Texas and (ii) a student housing community in State College, Pennsylvania. We contributed an aggregate of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1548-wk-Fact-674C2C9724525F169E23C9103EDAE3E1" name="us-gaap:RealEstateInvestmentPropertyAtCost" contextRef="FI2019Q4_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">95.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for our initial ownership interests in these joint ventures, which ranged from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1552-wk-Fact-336DD2704CB755D7ACEFEA461318E844" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestmentOwnershipPercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_RentalPropertyJointVenturesnewfiscal2019Member_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_CoVenturerMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">50</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1556-wk-Fact-B38B63A8E34A588FBB4B632ECEFB0AEE" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestmentOwnershipPercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_RentalPropertyJointVenturesnewfiscal2019Member_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_CoVenturerMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">98</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Due to our controlling financial interest, our power to direct the activities that most significantly impact each joint venture&#8217;s performance, and/or our obligation to absorb expected losses or receive benefits from these joint ventures, we consolidated these joint ventures at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and October 31, 2019. Our partners&#8217; interests aggregating </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1577-wk-Fact-2E1111D22F74582A969A244D70BF6DEF" name="us-gaap:NoncontrollingInterestInVariableInterestEntity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">43.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1581-wk-Fact-FE7CE72D3FD15AE1980733E6A04B9DAC" name="us-gaap:NoncontrollingInterestInVariableInterestEntity" contextRef="FI2019Q4_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">41.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in the joint ventures are reflected as a component of &#8220;Noncontrolling interest&#8221; in our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and October 31, 2019, respectively. These joint ventures intend to obtain additional equity investors and secure third-party financing at a later date. At such time, it is expected that these entities would no longer be consolidated.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In fiscal 2019, we entered into a joint venture with unrelated parties to develop, build, and operate single-family rental communities. As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we have invested </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1597-wk-Fact-3DF4E4480DA85BECABAB2B6B4C7ED2EB" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAssociatesAndJointVentures" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_SingleFamilyBuildtoRentJVMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in this joint venture and have committed to invest up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1601-wk-Fact-F0C23D01389F5A1FA4A0993587D2E6AE" name="us-gaap:OtherCommitment" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_SingleFamilyBuildtoRentJVMember_us-gaap_OtherCommitmentsAxis_tol_CommitmentToAdvanceOrInvestInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAndJointVentureMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">60.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In 1998, we formed the Trust to invest in commercial real estate opportunities. The Trust is effectively owned one-third by us; one-third by current and former members of our senior management; and one-third by an unrelated party. As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, our investment in the Trust was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1612-wk-Fact-F504A2AEA1A85808B2D582988930F705" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAssociatesAndJointVentures" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_TollBrothersRealtyTrustMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">zero</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> as cumulative distributions received from the Trust have been in excess of the carrying amount of our net investment. We provide development, finance, and management services to the Trust and recognized fees under the terms of various agreements in the amount of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1616-wk-Fact-1B45D21B89205D1198497672D7C22D1E" name="us-gaap:PropertyManagementFeeRevenue" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_TollBrothersRealtyTrustMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in each of the </span><span 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Gibraltar Joint Ventures</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">We, through our wholly owned subsidiary, Gibraltar Capital and Asset Management, LLC (&#8220;Gibraltar&#8221;), have entered into </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1640-wk-Fact-FCAA719155A35F0EA8A0F8E2DB3B1C2E" name="tol:NumberofJointVentures" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_GibraltarLandBankingDevelopmentJointVenturesMemberMember" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">six</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> ventures with an institutional investor to provide builders and developers with land banking and venture capital. These ventures will finance builders&#8217; and developers&#8217; acquisition and development of land and home sites and pursue other complementary investment strategies. We also are a member in a separate venture with the same institutional investor, which purchased, from Gibraltar, certain foreclosed real estate owned and distressed loans in fiscal 2016. Our ownership interest in these ventures is approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1644-wk-Fact-E05BC7E17FF857B3B5CD7131A801A410" name="us-gaap:EquityMethodInvestmentOwnershipPercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_GibraltarLandBankingDevelopmentJointVenturesMemberMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">25</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. We may invest up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1648-wk-Fact-F09C47860B6A5456A716AD2D52691783" name="us-gaap:OtherCommitment" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_GibraltarLandBankingDevelopmentJointVenturesMemberMember_us-gaap_OtherCommitmentsAxis_tol_CommitmentToAdvanceOrInvestInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAndJointVentureMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in these ventures. As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we had an aggregate investment of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1656-wk-Fact-4ADC43D2B2665B08B880E92829668AAE" name="us-gaap:InvestmentsInAffiliatesSubsidiariesAssociatesAndJointVentures" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ScheduleOfEquityMethodInvestmentEquityMethodInvesteeNameAxis_tol_GibraltarLandBankingDevelopmentJointVenturesMemberMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">21.4</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in these ventures.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Guarantees</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The unconsolidated entities in which we have investments generally finance their activities with a combination of partner equity and debt financing. In some instances, we and our partners have guaranteed debt of certain unconsolidated entities. These guarantees may include any or all of the following: (i) project completion guarantees, including any cost overruns; (ii) repayment guarantees, generally covering a percentage of the outstanding loan; (iii) carry cost guarantees, which cover costs such as interest, real estate taxes, and insurance; (iv) an environmental indemnity provided to the lender that holds the lender harmless from and against losses arising from the discharge of hazardous materials from the property and non-compliance with applicable environmental laws; and (v) indemnification of the lender from &#8220;bad boy acts&#8221; of the unconsolidated entity.</span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">10</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-D779C4A45EE95DC7A26902E65B80039B-4" continuedAt="TextSelection-D779C4A45EE95DC7A26902E65B80039B-5"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">In some instances, the guarantees provided in connection with loans to an unconsolidated entity are joint and several. In these situations, we generally have a reimbursement agreement with our partner that provides that neither party is responsible for more than its proportionate share or agreed upon share of the guarantee; however, if a joint venture partner does not have adequate financial resources to meet its obligations under the reimbursement agreement, we may be liable for more than our proportionate share. </span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">We believe that, as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, in the event we become legally obligated to perform under a guarantee of an obligation of an unconsolidated entity due to a triggering event, the collateral in such entity should be sufficient to repay a significant portion of the obligation. If it is not, we and our partners would need to contribute additional capital to the venture. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, certain unconsolidated entities have loan commitments aggregating </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1680-wk-Fact-D138590F314B562EB81E5ACCC2395FF4" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.27</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, of which, if the full amount of the debt obligations were borrowed, we estimate </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1684-wk-Fact-EA01907914075A02A90F029EB09C3D95" name="tol:GuaranteesRepaymentandCarryCostMaximum" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">183.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to be our maximum exposure related to repayment and carry cost guarantees. At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the unconsolidated entities had borrowed an aggregate of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1693-wk-Fact-08B9F65112BD5306BF474DE2D00FAEF4" name="us-gaap:LineOfCredit" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">825.3</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, of which we estimate </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1697-wk-Fact-7CF356E51FC5574892494AE7F145B429" name="tol:MaximumrepapymentandcarrycostguaranteeobligationforborrowingsbyJV" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">114.1</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to be our maximum exposure related to repayment and carry cost guarantees. The terms of these guarantees generally range from </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d10596845e1701-wk-Fact-EB3E4E9818035B6A89EB663D995D2D47" name="us-gaap:GuaranteeObligationsTerm" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MinimumMember_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" format="ixt-sec:durmonth">7</ix:nonNumeric> months</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonNumeric id="d10596845e1705-wk-Fact-10529CFC6CE556419F4A0C901AA6C806" name="us-gaap:GuaranteeObligationsTerm" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_srt_RangeAxis_srt_MaximumMember_us-gaap_GuaranteeObligationsByNatureAxis_us-gaap_IndirectGuaranteeOfIndebtednessMember_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" format="ixt-sec:duryear">3.9</ix:nonNumeric> years</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. These maximum exposure estimates do not take into account any recoveries from the underlying collateral or any reimbursement from our partners.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the estimated aggregate fair value of the guarantees provided by us related to debt and other obligations of certain unconsolidated entities was approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1716-wk-Fact-68DEE5987C665BE289A313B7451278DD" name="us-gaap:GuaranteesFairValueDisclosure" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">5.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. We have not made payments under any of the guarantees, nor have we been called upon to do so.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Variable Interest Entities</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we determined that </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1734-wk-Fact-653694D80855558682214B0AF9FA0BA3" name="tol:NumberOfEntitiesThatAreConsideredVariableInterestEntities" contextRef="FI2020Q1" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">16</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1738-wk-Fact-2F01246B43F95941A303208C43F81B94" name="tol:NumberOfEntitiesThatAreConsideredVariableInterestEntities" contextRef="FI2019Q4" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">18</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of our joint ventures, respectively, were VIEs under the guidance of ASC 810, &#8220;Consolidation.&#8221; For </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1742-wk-Fact-0DCE088103CF5469BA95178F0D88A53F" name="tol:NumberOfUnconsolidatedEntitiesThatAreConsideredVariableInterestEntities" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">11</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1747-wk-Fact-AB5C65CEF26B5E29898415994C471A05" name="tol:NumberOfUnconsolidatedEntitiesThatAreConsideredVariableInterestEntities" contextRef="FI2019Q4_us-gaap_RelatedPartyTransactionsByRelatedPartyAxis_us-gaap_EquityMethodInvesteeMember" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">13</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of these VIEs as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> and </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">October&#160;31, 2019</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, respectively, we concluded that we were not the primary beneficiary of these VIEs because the power to direct the activities of such VIEs that most significantly impact their performance was either shared by us and such VIEs&#8217; other partners or such activities were controlled by our partner. For VIEs where the power to direct significant activities is shared, business plans, budgets, and other major decisions are required to be unanimously approved by all members. Management and other fees earned by us are nominal and believed to be at market rates, and there is no significant economic disproportionality between us and the other members. The information presented below regarding the investments, commitments, and guarantees in unconsolidated entities deemed to be VIEs is also included in the information provided above.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">As of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we have consolidated </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1766-wk-Fact-253723A4BDA15E42B460DEAFE7DF6031" name="us-gaap:NumberOfRealEstateProperties" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="joint_ventures" decimals="0" scale="0" format="ixt-sec:numwordsen">five</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> Rental Property Joint Ventures. The carrying value of these joint ventures&#8217; assets totaling </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1770-wk-Fact-C37914A921B4EE12ACBCA0E7C89CF238" name="us-gaap:VariableInterestEntityConsolidatedCarryingAmountAssets" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">157.9</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> is reflected in &#8220;Receivables, prepaid expenses, and other assets&#8221; in our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Our partners&#8217; interests aggregating </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10596845e1778-wk-Fact-2E1111D22F74582A969A244D70BF6DEF" name="us-gaap:NoncontrollingInterestInVariableInterestEntity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_tol_RentalJointVenturesincludingTrustsiandIIMember_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntitiesByClassificationOfEntityAxis_us-gaap_VariableInterestEntityPrimaryBeneficiaryMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">43.5</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> in the joint ventures are reflected as a component of &#8220;Noncontrolling interest&#8221; in our Condensed Consolidated Balance Sheet as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. These joint ventures were determined to be VIEs due to their current inability to finance their activities without additional subordinated financial support as well as our partners&#8217; inability to participate in the significant decisions of the joint venture and their lack of substantive kick-out rights. We further concluded that we are the primary beneficiary of these VIEs due to our controlling financial interest in such ventures as we have the power to direct the activities that most significantly impact the joint ventures&#8217; performance and the obligation to absorb expected losses or receive benefits from the joint ventures. The assets of these VIEs can only be used to settle the obligations of the VIEs. In addition, in certain of the joint ventures, in the event additional contributions are required to be funded to the joint ventures prior to the admission of any additional investor at a future date, we will fund 100% of such contributions, including our partner&#8217;s pro rata share, which we expect would be funded through an interest-bearing loan.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e678-wk-Fact-FC42CF0C386852EA85C41F942505571E" name="us-gaap:UnsecuredLongTermDebt" At </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, the interest rate on borrowings was </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e690-wk-Fact-E0E8A4ABDA7D5ED6BF9E03671E3A79C9" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentInterestRateEffectivePercentage" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_DebtInstrumentAxis_tol_SeniorunsecuredtermloanMember" unitRef="number" decimals="4" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.70</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> per annum. We and substantially all of our </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e695-wk-Fact-7B54B4DEA00C5000BD19AFCEFFF80EDE" name="us-gaap:MinorityInterestOwnershipPercentageByParent" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_srt_GuarantorSubsidiariesMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">-owned home building subsidiaries are guarantors under the Term Loan Facility. The Term Loan Facility contains substantially the same financial covenants as the Revolving Credit Facility described below.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Revolving Credit Facility</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">We have a </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e705-wk-Fact-9987AE2A9274588EA851B6A802A4BBC7" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_Oct2019RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-6" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.905</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, five-year senior unsecured revolving credit facility (the &#8220;Revolving Credit Facility&#8221;) with a syndicate of banks. The Revolving Credit Facility is scheduled to mature on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">November 1, 2024</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. We and substantially all of our </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e713-wk-Fact-7B54B4DEA00C5000BD19AFCEFFF80EDE" name="us-gaap:MinorityInterestOwnershipPercentageByParent" contextRef="FI2020Q1_srt_ConsolidatedEntitiesAxis_srt_GuarantorSubsidiariesMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">100</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">-owned home building subsidiaries are guarantors under the Revolving Credit Facility.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">Under the terms of the Revolving Credit Facility, at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, our maximum leverage ratio, as defined, may not exceed </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e724-wk-Fact-82FECD7F859B5F2BA6054DD737E4F2A0" name="tol:MaximumPermissibleLeverageRatio" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.75</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to 1.00, and we are required to maintain a minimum tangible net worth, as defined, of no less than approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e728-wk-Fact-3FB917EFCF02550DA1A7737B89B03FF6" name="us-gaap:MinimumNetWorthRequiredForCompliance" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-7" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">2.24</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Under the terms of the Revolving Credit Facility, at </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, our leverage ratio was approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e736-wk-Fact-BE48A3D4823C5F269E1594164DEAD875" name="tol:ExistingLeverageRatio" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="number" decimals="2" scale="0" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">0.72</ix:nonFraction></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> to </span></div></ix:continuation><div><br/></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">13</span></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"></hr><div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div></div><div><br/></div><ix:continuation id="TextSelection-B6AE6D9169CD57469EAF4122A5E2D705-2"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1.00, and our tangible net worth was approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e743-wk-Fact-5C4875AB6CBE5F75B57C59976A402457" name="tol:TangibleNetWorth" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-7" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">4.61</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. Based upon the limitations related to our repurchase of common stock in the Revolving Credit Facility, our ability to repurchase our common stock was limited to approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e747-wk-Fact-36A64CE854475F52AA2F1765E0A96639" name="tol:Abilitytorepurchasecommonstock" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-7" scale="9" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">3.14</ix:nonFraction> billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. In addition, under the provisions of the Revolving Credit Facility, our ability to pay cash dividends was limited to approximately </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e755-wk-Fact-8284851B62385336A52EE19A0083998A" name="tol:Abilitytopaydividends" billion</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> as of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span Subsequent to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">January&#160;31, 2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, we borrowed an additional </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e791-wk-Fact-4BCF78C7EA7AC868155CA7A87956A6E1" name="us-gaap:ProceedsFromLinesOfCredit" contextRef="D2020Q1Sharerepurchase_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_tol_May2016RevolvingCreditFacilityMember_us-gaap_SubsequentEventTypeAxis_us-gaap_SubsequentEventMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">200.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> under the Revolving Credit Facility.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:bold;">Loans Payable &#8211; Other</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;padding-top:10px;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#8220;Loans payable &#8211; other&#8221; primarily represents purchase money mortgages on properties we acquired that the seller had financed and various revenue bonds that were issued by government entities on our behalf to finance community infrastructure and our manufacturing facilities. subsidiary, entered into a mortgage warehousing agreement (the &#8220;Warehousing Agreement&#8221;) with a bank to finance the origination of mortgage loans by TBI Mortgage. The Warehousing Agreement is accounted for as a secured borrowing under ASC 860, &#8220;Transfers and Servicing.&#8221; In December 2018, the Warehousing Agreement was amended to provide for loan purchases up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e839-wk-Fact-0EF68AFF3EF75838B42032FEB32A40F5" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityCurrentBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_WarehouseAgreementBorrowingsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-3" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">75.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, subject to certain sublimits. In addition, the Warehousing Agreement, as amended, provides for an accordion feature under which TBI Mortgage may request that the aggregate commitments under the Warehousing Agreement be increased to an amount up to </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span>$<ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e843-wk-Fact-59144CFF3179540E9F9C8935B02DDE64" name="us-gaap:LineOfCreditFacilityMaximumBorrowingCapacity" contextRef="FI2020Q1_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_WarehouseAgreementBorrowingsMember" unitRef="usd" decimals="-5" scale="6" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">150.0</ix:nonFraction> million</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> for a short period of time. In December 2019, the Warehousing Agreement was amended to extend the expiration date on substantially the same terms as the existing agreement.  The Warehousing Agreement, as amended, expires on </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><span style="white-space:nowrap"><ix:nonNumeric id="d10593044e847-wk-Fact-BB8613B1D6D75CDD807721A0B3E6AAEF" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentMaturityDate" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_WarehouseAgreementBorrowingsMember" format="ixt:datemonthdayyearen">December 4, 2020</ix:nonNumeric></span></span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">, and borrowings thereunder bear interest at LIBOR plus </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10593044e851-wk-Fact-2349F05CD59A5597BFF03FA2AF81B07F" name="us-gaap:DebtInstrumentBasisSpreadOnVariableRate1" contextRef="FD2020Q1YTD_us-gaap_CreditFacilityAxis_us-gaap_WarehouseAgreementBorrowingsMember_us-gaap_VariableRateAxis_us-gaap_LondonInterbankOfferedRateLIBORMember" unitRef="number" decimals="4" scale="-2" format="ixt:numdotdecimal">1.90</ix:nonFraction>%</span></span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> per annum. style="text-align:right;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><span><ix:nonFraction id="d10596189e1182-wk-Fact-8119B76BB1775A27ACB263718BACD2E2"
